inn1.comm: length delivery on the off stump, pushed down to mid-on
outside off and shapes it away from the batsman, who lets it go
drifts towards the pads this time and Guptill gets off the mark by helping it to fine leg
swinging in from around the off stump towards the pads, worked to the leg side to get off the mark
falls just short of Kula! This was swinging in too, Guptill pushed it back, maybe a bit too early, and the ball nearly carried back to Kula, who dived forward but it was just out of his reach
back of length outside the off stump, pushed to cover
short of length on off stump, Baz goes back and defends it back
he's smoked that for six, what a shot from Baz! Danced down the track and made some room, and absolutely smacked that over the cover boundary for a big six
shortish and well outside off, he stays on the back foot and tucks it towards third man for one
length delivery coming in towards off stump, pushed back to the bowler
length delivery coming in towards off, Guptill drives and manages an inside edge off the pads to the leg side for one
angled in towards the batsman and he works it towards square leg for one
outside off, punched towards sweeper cover for one
back of length outside off, Guptill defends on the off side and gets another inside edge on the leg side for one
outside off on length, driven straight to cover
another good-length delivery outside off, Baz leans forward and defends solidly
touch wider outside off and Baz gets room to steer it to deep point for one
drivable length outside off, Guptill lets it go
charges down again and the result's the same - six! Prasad chased Baz with a shortish delivery as he came down and made room, but Baz's quick arms pulled that over the fine-leg boundary for six
short of length ball angled in, tucked towards midwicket for one, but off the pad for a leg bye
slightly full outside off, Guptill drives it down to mid off
tempting line and length to drive just outside off, Guptill moves a bit towards the ball and leaves

loud appeal for lbw, Billy Bowden says no. It was angled in from outside off, Guptill put his front foot forward and was beaten as the ball came in, was struck in front of the stumps but slightly high maybe. After a lot of discussion Mathews reviewed it but was late on it
swings it in from well outside off, Guptill lets it go
length delivery swinging in, Baz pushes it to cover
room outside off and Baz punches it off the back foot into the gap past the cover fielders for four
leans forward this time to block the length delivery outside off
slightly towards middle and leg, flicked to midwicket by McCullum
back to the outside off line, he drives it to cover
driven in the air and that's just wide of mid-off for another boundary. It was pitched up outside off with a bit of room too, and Baz lofted it in the air over cover and wide of mid-off
length delivery outside off, he leans forward a bit and defends
slightly full around off, driven back straight to the bowler
goes across again as the ball is angled in and manages an inside edge onto his pad as it goes down leg before Sanga collects it
on length outside off, Guptill closes the face towards leg with soft hands to steal a quick single
big heave and a miss! Baz swung his bat for the length delivery just outside off as it held its line after pitching, and his cross-bat slog didn't connect at all
he connects this time, but it won't go all the way. Charged down and swished at it on the off side, almost taking it on the full, and third man ran to his right to cut it off
quick single, run out chance, he's safe! Pushed the length delivery around off with soft hands towards mid off and took off early to make it on time. The fielder also didn't hit the stumps
good-length delivery around off, pushed back to the bowler
slightly shorter outside off, pushed off the back foot wide of cover for one
drives outside off, doesn't middle it again and gets an inside edge onto the pad before it goes towards slip
drivable length outside off and it's driven down straight to mid off

that's like a fake tennis shot for six! It was full and angled in, Guptill's front foot went across a bit and he lofted it over the wide long on boundary to send it all the way. But he didn't see where the ball was going and just kept his head down

and he gets the big wicket first ball, that was a very good catch by Kula behind square on leg. Baz mistimed the pull and got a leading edge which went pretty high on the leg side, Kula ran to his left quite a bit from short fine leg and dived in the end to catch it with both hands

another loud appeal, another one turned down! Pretty similar to the first appeal as Guptill put his front foot across and was beaten by the incoming delivery, but Bowden said no again as he was struck just around off stump
and another appeal turned down! This one was closer as it swung in little bit, Guptill struck on the front foot again in front of leg stump and it went down leg for four leg byes
fullish delivery outside off, driven straight to short cover
on length outside off, pushed into the covers off the front foot
length delivery on the off stump, he leans forward and blocks it
pushes the length delivery outside off into the covers
touch shorter, Latham stays back and stands tall to defend it to cover
drives uppishly and a thick outside edge goes down to third man for one. It was on length and well outside off, Latham reached out for it and drove away from the body to send it in the air for a bit
length delivery outside off with some late outswing, Guptill lets it go
tries to pull and misses! It was a bouncer, not that quick, and Guptill tried to come inside the line to pull but missed it
on length on the off stump, Guptill blocks it back
length delivery outside off with the angle, Latham lets it go
touch closer to the batsman on similar length, he defends it on off
length delivery on the off stump, blocked into the covers by Latham
oh, beautiful delivery! He drew Latham forward with the length delivery outside off, there was swing too and it beat Latham completely

fuller on the off stump, Latham drives it back straight to the bowler who gets a hand to it and Guptill dives to make his ground at the non-striker's end. The ball deflected off the bowler's hand to Guptill, not the stumps
length delivery just outside off, left alone by Latham
drives it on the off side, but doesn't middle it. It was on length outside off, he lofted it over the covers but the bat swiveled in his hand and he got two before it was cut off in the deep
short ball angled in, he pulls and gets a glove over the keeper down the leg side for four
length ball on the stumps, pushed down to mid on for one
that's beautifully timed for four! It was slightly full on the off stump, he merely pushed it straight down the ground past Guptill with such sweet timing it had to go for four
pushes the straighter delivery with soft hands down to mid on for a quick one
slightly back of length, he rocks back to punch it down to long on for one
reaches out and pushes the delivery from outside off past point for one
appeal for another lbw but this one pitched outside leg. Latham went across and was hit in front of the stumps, but that one had to be not out
outside off now on length, he defends it to cover
length ball on the legs, tucked off the pads towards mid on for one
on length on the stumps, pushed down towards mid-on for a quick single
pretty wide outside off, Latham steers it wide of third man for one
on length around the off stump, driven down to mid off
outside leg this time, tucked off the hips to fine leg for one
defends the back of length delivery outside off, wants one but is sent back
on the pads this time and it's tucked to deep square leg for one
wide enough outside off for Latham to guide it to third man with a late cut
back of length outside off, defends it to point and says no first for the single, and then for the overthrow
touch short of length outside off, defends it off the back foot towards short cover
wider outside off, driven through the covers off the front foot for one
that's the shot of the day for Guptill! Gets a full delivery on off and drives it straight down the ground with good timing to collect four
slightly closer to middle stump, pushed down to long on for one
outside off and swishes it to sweeper cover for one
slightly full and outside off, driven off the front foot to sweeper cover for one
edged and four past the keeper! That was fullish outside off, Guptill drove for another edge - outside edge this time - and it raced past the keeper for four. No slips in place
much better from Guptill - drives that one straight down the ground and the bowler gets his right foot in the way to deflect it to the leg side
pretty full on the stumps, pushed down to mid on
fullish on the legs, tucked off the pads towards midwicket for one
on length on the stumps, he blocks it back on the off side
nice teasing line just outside off, Guptill looked to drive and left it just at the right time
bit of flight on the off stump, he leans forward and defends
touch outside off now, cuts it late to backward point
flighted on middle and leg stumps, leans forward and blocks it back
uses his feet this time to take it on the full and flicks it away against the spin from middle stump to the leg side for a one-bounce four
slightly flat on the off stump, he blocks it after pressing forward
shorter and wider outside off, cut off the back foot to sweeper cover for one
beats him outside off! Latham poked at this one as it angled across him from outside off, he didn't move his feet and missed it completely
on the pads now and it's tucked away to deep square leg for one
defends the length delivery with a bit of a forward lean on the off side
full outside off, driven down to mid off for a quick single
yorks him outside the off stump, Latham dabs and misses
steers this wider delivery outside off to third man for one. And that's drinks
goes back to push a good length ball that barely turns to mid-on
tossed up a shade outside off, defended off the front foot
eases down the pitch and drives to long-on
lunges forward to defend a tossed up delivery outside off
lines up this delivery on middle and leg and plants his bat in front of his front foot
turned away to short midwicket as Senanayake continues the strangle
leans forward to a fuller delivery and rides it to the sweeper. Sweet impact
just back of a good length and Guptill is happy to block
knocks the fuller delivery on leg stump down to long-on to bring up the fifty partnership
keeps him on the back foot and Latham dabs it into the covers. Says no right away to Guptill taking a few steps down the pitch
defends a shortish delivery on middle and leg
nudged towards the midwicket region and Thisara gets on it himself
good length ball on off stump, goes back and pushes into the covers
a shade short and Latham waits on it to slice to point
goes back and runs a shortish ball to point again. He's looking to play it late and beat the man on his right, but not timing it for now
flighted on middle, kept out solidly
looped up on leg stump and Latham pulls out his favorite sweep, one-bounce to the deep square leg fielder
short and a shade wide, Guptill slaps it to the covers. Falls short of the fielder moving to his left
good length ball on off stump, defended to mid-off
magnificent! It was a poor ball, but how well did Guptill deal with it. Stood up tall, slammed it well in front of square and hammered it over deep midwicket's head. Flat missile
shortish and outside off, Guptill is on the back foot with a push into the covers
beautiful bit of cricket from Latham now as he leans forward and dabs a fuller delivery outside off to the right of cover and drags his partner across for a quick single
lashed through the covers, seems like Guptill's decided he doesn't like his present strike rate all that much
back of a length on off stump, steered to the sweeper. Guptill was angling for a second, but the throw is in too quick
gets down the track and nurdles a good length ball through midwicket
flighted and drifting on the pads, glanced to short fine leg
jumps on the back foot after seeing the flatter length and slaps it into the covers
brings down a straight face on a tossed up delivery and drives to long-on
tucked to long-on with Latham knowing there isn't going to be any spin
makes Guptill reach to the pitch of this well flighted delivery and drive a bit away from the body into the covers
pushes his balance forward and taps the back of a length delivery through the covers
tucks him up on middle, but there are plenty of open spaces on the leg side. There's actually no one inside the circle in front of square and Guptill works it away wide of long-on
phew! That's a stunner as well, plants his front leg down a la Shane Watson to pick up a length ball and deposit it over long-off. That's fifty!
cramped for room, but powers away the shortish ball outside off to deep point

gets an inside edge to the attempted glide to third man and is called over for a quick single by Guptill. Latham was only momentarily concerned about the ball bouncing onto the stumps and once he knew that wasn't going to happen, he got his skates on. Lovely cricket.
good length ball on off stump, defended
uses his feet and chipped to the midwicket boundary! That's the second time he's profited from a stroke that seemed destined for one, at best! What timing!
knows the length will be shorter, so stays back and clips through square leg
good length on middle, Guptill punches back at the bowler
pure power form Guptill, and this short ball outside off merited every bit of it. Clatters into the cover boundary. Looks like Senanayake is not able to grip the ball properly with the rain still on
this one slides down leg. Definite signs of Sachithra struggling to grip the ball.
on the pads and Guptill nudges to deep midwicket
keeps to the crease and turns a good length ball to square leg
good length ball brings Guptill forward as he drives to cover
pierces the gap on the off side in front of point as he spots some width to a back of a length delivery
waits on a shortish delivery and unveils a late cut to third man. Well played
back of a length on off stump, Guptill pushes to mid-on
just a tad overpitched and Guptill has drilled it to long-on. And out comes the towel again.
full on middle, turned towards midwicket
flighted on leg stump, picked away to long-on
a bit short, but it skids off the deck to ruin Latham's intended glide. Finds cover when he was looking squarer
jumps back and slices a shortish ball through point
pushes down to long-on as Senanayake looks to refuse Guptill any room
gets down the pitch, but Senanayake has pulled his length back. Latham can only defend
goes back to punch a shortish delivery to long-on
uses the angle across the left-hander, who doesn't do much with his feet and is beaten while trying to ride the ball to third man
shortish and outside off, slapped straight to point
launched down the ground, looks like the instructions are quite clear now. Manufactures a four as he picks up a good length ball and exploits mid-on who was up
good length on off stump, keeps Latham quiet

third man was too tempting, blinded Latham to the lack of width on this ball and Mathews strikes with the change of pace. The inside edge of the angle blade is taken off the shortish delivery and deflects onto the stumps
bouncer straight up and Rosco is happy to crouch under it
flighted on middle and leg, Guptill works it to long-on
pulls his pace back to the new batsman and flights it on off stump, Taylor nudges to short midwicket
uses the line on leg stump to glance the good length ball to short fine leg and grab a single
seems to have got into the push a bit too early, but then adjusts to the flatter delivery and picks up the single to long-off
tapped to long-on as he gets forward to the flighted ball on middle
long-on gets another work out as Guptill trusts a straight blade to a good length ball
back of a good length on off stump, safely negotiated
gets forward to a shortish delivery on off stump and tries to pick the gap on the leg side, but short midwicket's quite alert
quick single and Taylor succeeds in his endeavor after tapping the back of a length ball towards mid-on and setting off straight away. Good response from Guptill too
clips the good length ball off his pads and finds deep midwicket

two in two overs for Mathews! But Taylor's reviewed it straight away. He had moved across to a good length ball on middle and leg, quite a long way actually, and has been rapped in front of middle. On the knee-roll. HotSpot shows no edge either. Looks like New Zealand are headed towards a lost review. And yep, the ball tracker said it would clip leg stump and sides with umpire's call
